sen.j: 永久の強訴（えいきゅうのごうそ）とは、天永4年・永久 (元号)元年（1113年）、興福寺の末寺・清水寺の別当に延暦寺で出家した仏師・円勢が任じられたことから閏3月20日に数千人の興福寺大衆が人事の停止を求めて行われた強訴のこと。
sen.e: The Eikyu-no-Goso was a collective petition to the Imperial Court by a few thousand monks at the Kofuku-ji Temple on April 7, 1113, requesting Ensei, a sculptor of Buddhist statues who became a priest at Enryaku-ji Temple and was appointed to the position of the betto (the superior of a temple) of the Kiyomizu-dera Temple, a branch temple of the Kofuku-ji Temple, be dismissed from the position.

sen.j: 円勢は法勝寺・尊勝寺の仏像群の造立を主導しており、白河法皇への奉仕に対する論功行賞ともいえる強引な人事だった。
sen.e: Ensei led the construction of Buddhist statues at the Hossho-ji Temple and the Sonsho-ji Temple, and because of this, the aggressive appointment was processed as if it had been a reward for his service to the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa.

sen.j: 法皇は譲歩し一旦は終結するかに思われたが、興福寺大衆が上洛の折に祇園社神人に暴行を働いたたため、29日に延暦寺大衆が報復する。

sen.j: 清水寺の堂舎を破壊して神輿をかつぎ、院御所である大炊殿におしかけ興福寺の権少僧都・実覚の流罪を要求した。
sen.e: Those for the Enryaku-ji destroyed small and large buildings of the Kiyomizu-dera Temple, carried the mikoshi (portable shrine carried in festivals), and burst into the oidono (kitchen hall), In-Gosho (the imperial palace for retired and cloistered emperors), to demand that the gon shosozu (Junior lesser prelate) Jikkaku should be banished.

sen.j: 出羽守・源光国、丹後守・平正盛、左衛門尉・源為義が院御所・内裏を警固した。
sen.e: Dewa no kami (the governor of Dewa Province) MINAMOTO no Mitsukuni, Tango no kami (the governor of Tango Province) TAIRA no Masamori, and Saemon no jo (third-ranked officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi guarded the dairi (Imperial Palace) and In-Gosho.

sen.j: その場しのぎの対応で法皇が実覚処分の要求を飲んだことから興福寺が激怒、天台座主・仁豪と法性寺座主・寛慶の流罪、祇園社を春日大社の末社にすること、実覚の配流停止といった3ヵ条を奏上として提出した。
sen.e: The Kofuku-ji Temple was outraged by the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa's makeshift handling of the situation and acceptance of the request to punish Jikkaku, and submitted to the Emperor the three pleas that Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) Ningo and Head priest of Hossho-ji Temple Kankei be banished; that the Gion-sha Shrine be a subordinate shrine of the Kasuga-taisha Shrine; and that Jikkaku's banishment be halted.

sen.j: 大衆の上洛を防ぐため、宇治に平正盛・平忠盛・源重時が、西坂本に源光国・藤原盛重が配備された。
sen.e: To prevent monks from entering the capital, TAIRA no Masamori, TAIRA no Tadamori and MINAMOTO no Shigetoki were deployed to Uji, and MINAMOTO no Mitsukuni and FUJIWARA no Morishige to Nishi-Sakamoto.

sen.j: 宇治において双方が対峙中にたまたま現れた鹿（鹿は春日大社明神の使として信仰されていた）を兵士が射ようとしたことから合戦となり、大衆側に多数の戦死者が出た。
sen.e: When both of the sides faced each other in Uji, deer, which was believed to be a messenger from the deity of the Kasuga-taisha Shrine, appeared in front of them; one solder tried to shoot it and this incident caused the battle to begin, resulting in a large number of casualties among the side of the monks.

sen.j: 宇治に出動した正盛・忠盛・重時は検非違使だったが、検非違使別当・藤原宗忠の指示を介さず法皇の命令で派兵された。
sen.e: Masamori, Tadamori and Shigetoki, who were deployed to Uji, were the kebiishi (police and judicial chief), but they were ordered to be deployed by the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa without an instruction from FUJIWARA no Munetada, the kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police).

sen.j: 検非違使庁・諸衛府の形骸化、院北面の拡大を示す事件だった。
sen.e: This incident showed that the Kebiishicho (Office of Police and Judicial Chief) and various efu (Palace Guards) were losing substance while the In-no-hokumen (Imperial Palace Guards) were gaining more power.
